name: Section 8 Moderate Rehabilitation Single Room Occupancy
objective: The Section 8 Moderate Rehabilitation Single Room Occupancy Program provides rental assistance to homeless individuals. Under the program, HUD entered into Annual Contributions Contracts (ACCs) with public housing agencies (PHAs) in connection with the moderate rehabilitation of residential properties that, when rehabilitation is completed, will contain multiple single room dwelling units.  Funding for new projects ceased after 2011.  Expiring contracts are now renewed.
top_agency_name: Department of Housing and Urban Development
sub_agency_name: Assistant Secretary for Community Planning and Development
applicant_types: Private nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)

authorizations.text: McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act of 1987, Title IV, as amended.

rules_regulations: 24 CFR Part 882, Subpart H  Section 8 Moderate Rehabilitation Single Room Occupancy Program for Homeless Individuals, as well as 24 CFR, Part 5, Subparts A, E and F. Program information also available from Community Connections at HUD at (1-800) 998-9999.
